metadata.title: Recent Sightings of Harbor Porpoises, Phocoena phocoena, near Point Barrow, Alaska

creators.name: Dept. Wildl. Manage., North Slope Borough

metadata.description:
Harbor Porpoises occur regularly in the north Pacific Ocean and the Bering
     Sea and occasionally in the Chukchi Sea during the ice-free months. Point
     Barrow, Alaska is considered to be near the northern limit of distribution for
     this species. We have obtained nine records from the vicinity of Point Barrow
     between 1985 and 1991. Harbor Porpoises were found entangled in
     subsistence fishing nets, seen live or found dead on the beach. These records
     indicate a regular use of the northeastern Chukchi Sea and extreme western
     Beaufort Sea. The reasons for their occurrence near Point Barrow are
     unknown but the relative abundance of fish in coastal arctic lagoons may
     attract Harbor Porpoises northward.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: A report on the recent sightings of harbor porpoises, Phocoena phocoena, near Point Barrow, Alaska
